translation: After the eighth entry, in which the tenth son recites the verse on nirvāṇa and then explains the council of the five hundred, there was a Brāhmaṇa named Turuṣya who was present in the crowd. When he saw that these people wanted to fight over the relics, he feared harm and injury to Buddhism.

source_sentence: 今欲為君陳其損益。
translation: "Now, I'd like to present to you the merits of this case.

source_sentence: 我比曾聞此大沙門喬答摩氏，憐愍一切諸有情故，於無數劫熾然精勤忍怨害事，長時苦己讚行忍辱，由是因緣成無上覺，心行平等猶若虛空，於諸有情普皆濟度，眾生福盡捨棄涅槃。
translation: I've heard that this great ascetic Gautama showed compassion for all sentient beings by blazingly and diligently tolerating hateful acts for countless eons, long suffering himself and praising forbearance, and as a result became unsurpassedly enlightened, his mind was as equal in conduct as space, he saved all sentient beings, ended the merits of sentient beings, and abandoned nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 息化以來纔經七日，即興兵戰誠是相違。
translation: It's really a contradiction to start an army and fight only seven days after he stopped teaching.

source_sentence: 唯願諸人勿為鬪競，我為平分必令歡喜。
translation: Please don't fight, for I will make you rejoice by dividing it equally.

source_sentence: 佛身舍利分為八分，各將供養饒益群生，量舍利瓶願同惠我，持還本國建窣覩波。」
translation: The Buddha's relics are divided into eight parts, each of which will be offered to benefit all sentient beings, and I wish to have the vials of the relics measured and returned to my homeland to be built into a stūpa."

source_sentence: 時拘尸那城壯士聞已，報言：「可爾！
translation: When the strong man of Kuśinagara heard this, he replied, "That's right!

source_sentence: 然大師世尊長夜修忍，不為殺害廣如前說，仁今順教為我平分，斯為善事。」
translation: Still, the Bhagavān has long cultivated forbearance and refrained from killing as was explained in detail earlier, so now you should follow the teaching and equally divide it for me. This is a good deed."

source_sentence: 其婆羅門既蒙許可，即分舍利而為八分，第一分與拘尸那城諸壯士等廣興供養，第二分與波波邑壯士，第三分與遮羅博邑，第四分與阿羅摩處，第五分與吠率奴邑，第六分與劫比羅城諸釋迦子，第七分與吠舍離城栗姑毘子，第八分與摩伽陀國行雨大臣。
translation: When he was granted permission, the Brāhmaṇa divided the relics into eight parts, the first of which was given to the strong men of Kuśinagara to make offerings, the second to the strong men of Popāśinagara, the third to the town of Cālapāla, the fourth to the town of Arāma, the fifth to the town of Vaiśravaṇa, the sixth to the Śākya sons of Kapilavastu, the seventh to the Kurugupī sons of Vaiśālī, and the eighth to the minister of the rainy season in Magadha.

source_sentence: 此等諸人既分得已，各還本處起窣覩波，恭敬尊重伎樂香華盛興供養。
translation: After they had received their portions, each of these people returned to their original place, raised a stūpa, and honored them with reverence, music, flowers, and an abundance of offerings.

source_sentence: 時突路拏婆羅門將量舍利瓶，於本聚落起塔供養。
translation: The Brāhmaṇa Brahmans then measured the Śāriputra vase and built a stūpa at their original village to make offerings.

source_sentence: 有摩納婆名畢鉢羅，亦在眾中告諸人曰：「釋迦如來恩無不普，於仁聚落而般涅槃，世尊舍利非我有分，其餘炭燼幸願與我，於畢鉢羅處起塔供養。」
translation: A man named Pippalāyana also addressed the crowd, saying, "The Śākyamuni Tathāgata's kindnesses are not universally shared, and he has gone into parinirvāṇa at a benevolent colony; I don't own any of the Bhagavān's relics, so please give me the rest of the ashes and build a stūpa at Pippalāyana's place to make offerings."

source_sentence: 時贍部洲世尊舍利乃有八塔，第九瓶塔，第十炭塔。
translation: There were then eight stūpas of the Bhagavān's relics on Jambudvīpa, a ninth stūpa of bottles, and a tenth stūpa of charcoal.

source_sentence: 如來舍利總有一碩六斗分為八分，七分在贍部洲，其第四分阿羅摩處所得之者，在龍宮供養。
translation: The Tathāgata's relics totaled a sheaf of six pails divided into eight parts, seven of which were on Jambudvīpa, and the fourth part, which was obtained at Ārāma, was placed in the dragon palace for worship.

source_sentence: 又佛有四牙舍利：一在天帝釋處；一在健陀羅國；一在羯陵伽國；一在阿羅摩邑海龍王宮，各起塔供養。
translation: The Buddha also had four tooth relics: one in Indra's place, one in Kandhāra's country, one in Kaliṅga's country, and one in the palace of the sea dragon king at Aramāṇapura, each of which had a stūpa erected for his worship.

source_sentence: 時波咤離邑無憂王，便開七塔取其舍利，於贍部洲廣興靈塔八萬四千周遍供養。
translation: Then, King Aśoka of Pāṭaliputra opened seven stūpas and took their relics, building 84,000 spiritual stūpas all over the Jambudvīpa region to make offerings.

source_sentence: 由塔威德莊嚴世間，天龍藥叉諸人神等，咸皆恭敬尊重供養，能令正法光顯不滅，有所願求無不遂意。
translation: Because of the towers' authoritative power, which adorns the world, gods, dragons, yakṣas, humans, and other spirits all respect and venerate them and make offerings to them, they cause the true teaching to shine brightly and not perish, and their desires are not unfulfilled.

source_sentence: (已下序王舍城五百結集事)爾時釋迦如來生在釋種，於摩揭陀國成等正覺，婆羅痆斯轉妙法輪，拘尸那城壯士生地而取滅度。
translation: (Continued below, in the introduction to the council of the five hundred in Rājagṛha) At the time, the Śākyamuni Tathāgata was born in the Śākya lineage, became perfectly enlightened in Magadha, turned the wonderful Dharma wheel in Vārāṇasī, and attained extinction while being born in the city of Kuśinagara as a strong man.

source_sentence: 尊者舍利子與大苾芻眾八萬人同入涅槃，尊者大目連與七萬苾芻亦入涅槃，世尊與一萬八千苾芻亦般涅槃。
translation: Venerable Śāriputra and 80,000 great monks entered nirvāṇa together, Venerable Mahāmucilin and 70,000 monks also entered nirvāṇa, and the Bhagavān and 18,000 monks also passed into nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 時有多劫長壽諸天，見佛涅槃情懷悲感，又見諸聖悉皆滅度遂生譏議：「世尊所說蘇怛羅、毘奈耶、摩窒里迦，正真法藏皆不結集，豈令正教成灰燼耶？」
translation: Many long-lived gods were overcome with compassion when they saw the Buddha's nirvāṇa, and they also became critical when they saw that all the sages had been completely annihilated, saying, "Bhagavān's teaching about sūtra, vinaya, and mātikā is a collection of true dharmas that hasn't been collected, so won't the true teaching be reduced to ashes?"

source_sentence: 時大迦攝波知彼天意，告諸苾芻：「汝等當知！
translation: Then Mahākāśyapa, knowing the thoughts of those gods, addressed the monks, "You should know!

source_sentence: 具壽舍利子、具壽大目連，各與眾多大苾芻眾，不忍見佛入大涅槃，並悉於前已歸圓寂。
translation: Kauśāriputra and Kauśāriputra Mahāmucilin, along with a large assembly of great monks, couldn't bear to see the Buddha enter great nirvāṇa, and they all had previously returned to perfect extinction.

source_sentence: 而今世尊復與一萬八千苾芻同般涅槃。
translation: Now, the Bhagavān is again in parinirvāṇa with 18,000 monks.

source_sentence: 然有無量劫長壽諸天，皆起歎惜復生譏議：『何不結集三藏聖教，豈令如來甚深妙法成灰燼耶？』
translation: Still, there are long-lived gods of measureless eons who lament and criticize him, saying, 'Why didn't you gather the holy teachings of the Tripiṭaka and not let the Tathāgata's profound and wonderful teaching go up in smoke?'

source_sentence: 咸皆報知可共結集斯為大事。」
translation: Everyone will report that this is a great event for us to assemble together."

source_sentence: 眾皆言：「善！
translation: The crowd said, "Good!

source_sentence: 我等隨作。」
translation: We'll do as we please."

source_sentence: 時迦攝波白僧伽曰：「於此眾中誰為最小？」
translation: Kāśyapa then said to the saṃgha, "Who's the youngest of these people?"

source_sentence: 報曰：「具壽圓滿。」
translation: He replied, "Full and complete life span!"

source_sentence: 時大迦攝波告言：「圓滿！
translation: Mahākāśyapa then told him, "Complete!

source_sentence: 汝鳴揵稚令僧伽盡集。」
translation: You must sound the gandharva to cause the saṃgha to gather as many people as possible."

source_sentence: 圓滿聞已便於靜處入第四禪，隨其定力繫念思察。
translation: After hearing this, Pūrṇa then entered the fourth dhyāna in a quiet place and focused his thoughts and contemplated according to the power of his concentration.

source_sentence: 既觀察已從定而起即鳴揵稚，當有四百九十九大阿羅漢，從諸方來雲集於此就座而坐。
translation: After he had finished that observation, he rose from his meditation and fired his gandharva, when 499 great arhats from various directions gathered here to take their seats.

source_sentence: 尊者大迦攝波白言：「諸具壽苾芻僧伽悉來集未？
translation: Venerable Mahākāśyapa said, "Have all the life-size saṃgha gathered here yet?

source_sentence: 好審觀察是誰未集？」
translation: Who is it that has not yet gathered under scrutiny?"

source_sentence: 時諸苾芻咸遍觀察，報大迦攝波言：「諸方苾芻悉皆來集，唯具壽牛主今未來至。」
translation: The monks then all observed and reported to Mahākāśyapa, "All the monks from different directions have gathered here, except for the long-lived cowherd who's coming now."

source_sentence: 時牛主苾芻在尸利沙宮閑靜而住，大迦攝波告圓滿曰：「汝今可詣具壽牛主所居之處，作如是語告牛主言：『苾芻僧伽大迦攝波而為上首，令告尊者得無病不？
translation: When the monk Gavāṃpati was staying quietly at the Śirīṣa Palace, Mahākāśyapa addressed Pūrṇa, "Now, would you go to where Gavāṃpati is staying and tell the monk Gavāṃpati to say this, 'Monks, will you tell the venerable Gavāṃpati that you're the leader and that you'll be free of illness?'"

source_sentence: 僧伽有事宜可速來。』」
translation: Please come quickly if there's something the saṃgha wants to do.'"

source_sentence: 圓滿聞已入甚深定，以其定力於拘尸那城沒，尸利沙宮出，詣尊者前頂禮雙足，白尊者言：「苾芻僧伽大迦攝波而為上首，願言無病作如是說：『僧伽有事宜當速來。』」
translation: After hearing this, Pūrṇa entered into a very deep concentration, and with the power of his concentration, he left the city of Kuśinagara and emerged from the palace of Sirīṣa, went to the Venerable and bowed his head at his feet, and said to him, "The Bhagavān, the monk Saṃgha Mahākāśyapa, who is the head, vows to say that there's no illness and makes this statement, 'The Saṃgha will come quickly with its business.'"

source_sentence: 尊者雖離諸欲，仍有愛戀習氣，告圓滿曰：「善來具壽！
translation: Although he was free of desire, the Venerable still had the karmic impression of attachment, and he told Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra, "Well done, Kauśāmbī!

source_sentence: 將非大師釋迦牟尼如來，為有化緣向他界耶？
translation: Could it not be that the great teacher Śākyamuni the Tathāgata has created conditions that lead him to other realms?

source_sentence: 為諸僧伽有諍事耶？
translation: Is there a dispute over the saṃgha?

source_sentence: 為是如來所轉無上法輪，諸外道等生誹謗耶？
translation: Why do non-Buddhists denigrate the Tathāgata's turning of the unsurpassed wheel of the Dharma?

source_sentence: 又非外道等聚結徒黨，於我如來聲聞弟子為留難耶？
translation: Are you not a group of non-Buddhists or adherents who pose a problem to our disciples of the Tathāgata?

source_sentence: 不有如來諸弟子等煩惱增盛相輕賤耶？
translation: Are there not such things as disciples of the Tathāgata who are despised for the way their afflictions increase?

source_sentence: 不有沙門婆羅門違背佛教耶？
translation: Are there not ascetics and priests who deviate from Buddhism?

source_sentence: 非諸愚夫將破僧耶？
translation: Are you not foolish people who would destroy the saṃgha?

source_sentence: 不有惡見之人將像似法所有文句，惑亂如來真正法耶？
translation: Is there not a person with bad views who confuses the true teaching of the Tathāgata by using words and phrases that resemble the teaching?

source_sentence: 不有眾多同梵行者，棄廢讀誦禪思勝業，樂談世俗無益語耶？
translation: Aren't there many people who practice the same celibacy and abandon the excellent practice of reading, chanting, meditation, and contemplation and enjoy talking about worldly and useless things?

source_sentence: 又復不有心懷疑惑猶豫二途，非法說法法說非法、非律說律律說非律耶？
translation: Again, is there not a mind that doubts and hesitates about the two paths, which is not teaching the Dharma and teaching the Dharma as unlawful and teaching the Dharma and teaching the Dharma as unlawful when it's not the Dharma and teaching the Dharma and teaching the non-Dharma when it's not the Dharma?

source_sentence: 不有諸苾芻為慳貪垢之所擾亂，棄背六種和敬之法，見有客來及同梵行者，不相愛念耶？
translation: Are there any monks who, distracted by the stain of stinginess and greed, abandon the six rules of harmony and respect and don't think fondly of visitors and those who practice the same celibacy when they see them?

source_sentence: 不有惡性苾芻，令諸信心長者婆羅門等，背佛正法歸外道耶？
translation: Are there any monks of evil disposition who cause faithful elders and brāhmaṇas to turn their backs on the Buddha's true teaching and return to non-Buddhists?

source_sentence: 不有苾芻習行邪命耕田賣買，諂曲事王占相禍福，盡形貯畜不淨財耶？
translation: Are there any monks who practice wrong livelihoods, plow fields, sell, buy, flatter the king, divine fortune, or stock up on impure possessions?

source_sentence: 不有苾芻於杜多正行受下臥具生厭賤耶？
translation: Are there not monks who become disillusioned with the correct practice of duṣita and accept the necessities of lying down?

source_sentence: 不有實非沙門自言沙門，於同梵行所相惱亂耶？
translation: Isn't there really a non-monk who calls himself a monk and is disturbed by the same religious practice?

source_sentence: 然汝圓滿遠來至此，應言大德世尊安隱無事，乃稱迦攝波而為上首者，將非大悲世尊捨諸含識，永入無餘大涅槃界耶？
translation: But you, perfectly accomplished, have come from afar to say that the Bhagavān is at peace and unharmed, and yet you call Kāśyapa your superior, wouldn't you say that the Bhagavān is greatly compassionate, has abandoned the implied consciousnesses, and has permanently entered the great state of nirvāṇa without remainder?

source_sentence: 將非世間亡失船師生驚恐耶？
translation: Wouldn't the world be lost and the ship's teachers made afraid?

source_sentence: 將非十力無畏被無常鬼之所吞耶？
translation: Wouldn't you be among the ten powers and fearlessness that are swallowed up by a spirit of impermanence?

source_sentence: 將非能覺一切有情為開益者睡不覺耶？
translation: Wouldn't you be able to awaken all sentient beings who are asleep and unaware for the sake of enlightenment?

source_sentence: 將非佛日光沈沒耶？
translation: Wouldn't it be the sinking of the Buddha's sunlight?

source_sentence: 將非如來滿月被阿修羅怨而為障蔽隱光明耶？
translation: Could it be that the Tathāgata's full moon is obstructed by the grudge of an asura, which hides its light?

source_sentence: 將非三千世界最尊大師勝如意樹，菩提分華以為莊嚴，四聲聞果香美可愛，被無常狂象而摧折耶？
translation: Could it not be that the most venerable great teacher in the 3,000 worlds, the Tathāgata tree, adorned with the flowers of the bodhi tree, and the four śrāvaka fruits are beautiful and desirable, but are destroyed by the mad elephant of impermanence?

source_sentence: 將非如來智燈被無明風吹令滅耶？」
translation: Wouldn't the lamp of the Tathāgata's wisdom be blown out by the wind of ignorance?"

source_sentence: 爾時具壽圓滿，聞是語已說伽他曰：「聲聞眾已集，　　智慧皆猛利；　令法久住故，　　唯待於尊者。
translation: It was then that Kauśāmbī heard these words and spoke to Gṛdhrakūṭa, "The śrāvakas have gathered, and their wisdom is fierce; the only way to make the teaching last is to rely on the venerable.

source_sentence: 佛法船已沒，　　智慧山亦隤；　大師殊勝眾，　　普欲歸真寂。
translation: The ship of the Buddha's teachings has sunk, and the mountain of wisdom has been denounced; the great teacher's distinguished multitude wants to return to true peace.

source_sentence: 唯願速赴彼，　　共結世尊教；　是大事非輕，　　遣我來相命。」
translation: Please go there quickly and unite with the Bhagavān's teaching; this is a great matter, not a minor one, and I've been sent here for orders."

source_sentence: 是時具壽牛主告圓滿曰：「且止命言。」
translation: The long-lived cowherd then addressed Pūrṇa, saying, "Stop saying that."

source_sentence: 以頌報曰：「無上明燈若住世，　　我願往彼禮尊容；　今既緣盡入涅槃，　　何有智人能赴彼？
translation: He replied with a verse, "If the unsurpassed bright lamp were to remain in the world, I'd like to go there and pay homage to the venerable's countenance. Now that my conditions have ended and I've entered nirvāṇa, how could any wise person go there?

source_sentence: 汝今持我三衣鉢，　　與彼大眾應供者；　我今入寂更不生，　　唯願聖慈咸忍恕。」
translation: Now, take my three bowls and robes and offer them to the general public; now I'll enter into extinction and never be born again, so may noble compassion and forbearance prevail."

source_sentence: 說此語已即從座起，昇於虛空現十八變放種種光，化火焚身而取滅度，即於身內四道水流。
translation: After saying these words, he rose from his seat, ascended into the sky, showed 18 transformations, emitted various lights, burned his body in a fire, and achieved extinction, and then he flowed water in four paths within his body.

source_sentence: 第一水說伽他曰：「我等眾生福德盡，　　今時忽然逢棄背；　世間慧日已潛暉，　　一切群迷無救者。」
translation: The first water said to Gṛdhrakūṭa, "We sentient beings have run out of merit, and now we've suddenly met with abandonment; the sun of worldly wisdom has sunken into the sky, and there's no one to save all the misleading people."

source_sentence: 第二水說伽他曰：「一切諸行剎那滅，　　從生至盡皆歸苦；　但是凡夫虛妄計，　　作者受者悉皆無。」
translation: The second water teaches the jāti, saying, "All conditioned phenomena cease instantaneously, and from birth to the end they all return to suffering; but ordinary people falsely imagine that their authors and receptors are all nonexistent."

source_sentence: 第三水說伽他曰：「智者心常不放逸，　　於諸善法速修成；　容華年命並皆亡，　　恒被無常所吞食。」
translation: The third water teaches the kāṣāya, "A wise person's mind is always nonfrivolous, and he quickly cultivates good qualities; his appearance, flowers, years, and life all perish, and he's constantly devoured by impermanence."

source_sentence: 第四水說伽他曰：「我今稽首佛弟子，　　所應作者已成辦；　敬順大師入圓寂，　　如牛王去小牛隨。」
translation: The fourth water teaches the kāṭa, "Now, I bow down before the disciple of the Buddha, for I have accomplished what should be done; I obey the teacher and enter into perfect extinction, like a king of cattle departing with his calf following him."

source_sentence: 是時具壽圓滿，供養牛主遺身舍利已，持其衣鉢入甚深定，從室利沙宮沒，於拘尸那城雙林處現，詣大迦攝波及五百苾芻處隨應敬已，將其衣鉢置上座前。
translation: After making offerings to the relics of the cow owner's remains, he took his robe and bowl and entered a very deep concentration.

source_sentence: 說伽他曰：「彼聞聖主歸圓寂，　　所有福業亦隨行；　此是衣鉢我持來，　　唯願僧伽見容恕。」
translation: He said to them, "They've heard that the noble lord has passed away completely and that all his meritorious actions have followed suit; I brought this robe and bowl with me, and I hope the saṃgha will accept it."

source_sentence: 是時尊者迦攝波告苾芻曰：「同梵行者咸皆善聽。」
translation: Venerable Kāśyapa then addressed the monks, "All those who practice the same celibacy are listening well."

source_sentence: 說伽他曰：「彼隨聖教身已滅，　　所餘應供多涅槃；　現在和合眾同心，　　廣為人天當結集。」
translation: He said to the bhikṣuṇḍas, "The body that followed the noble teaching has ceased, and the remaining offerings have mostly been nirvāṇa. Now, we're united as a whole, and we'll gather a vast assembly of people and gods."

source_sentence: 時迦攝波復令大眾志念堅固莫入涅槃，說伽他曰：「仁等勿同彼牛主，　　室利沙宮入圓寂；　不應造次般涅槃，　　宜作眾生利益事。」
translation: Kāśyapa then again told the crowd to remain resolute in their resolve and not enter nirvāṇa, saying to the buddha, "Don't join that bull master, Sirīṣa, in entering the palace of perfect tranquility; you shouldn't create secondary nirvāṇas; you should work for the benefit of sentient beings."

source_sentence: 是時具壽大迦攝波，與五百苾芻共立制曰：「諸人當知聽我所說，佛日既沈恐法隨沒，今欲同聚結集法藏。
translation: Kauśāmbī then established a rule with five hundred monks, saying, "You should know that you've heard what I've taught, and since the Buddha's day has sunk and I'm afraid the Dharma will disappear, I want to gather together to assemble the Dharma treasury.

source_sentence: 彼諸人眾初喪大師情各憂惱，若即於此而結集者，四方僧眾來相喧擾，心既不安事難成辦。
translation: Those people who have just lost the great teacher are sad and troubled, so if they were to assemble here, the four directions of the saṃgha would be clamored for, and it would be difficult to accomplish anything because of their unease.

source_sentence: 然佛世尊在摩揭陀國菩提樹下成等正覺，法身已謝，我等今應就彼結集。」
translation: Nevertheless, since the Bhagavān has become perfectly enlightened under the bodhi tree in Magadha and has already given up the Dharma body, we should assemble it there now."

source_sentence: 有云：「大善！」
translation: It was said, "That's very good!"

source_sentence: 有云：「我等可詣菩提樹下。」
translation: It was said, "We may go under the bodhi tree."

source_sentence: 時大迦攝波告諸人曰：「摩揭陀國勝身之子，未生怨王初發信心，能以四事資身之具供給大眾令無有乏，我等宜應就彼結集。」
translation: Mahākāśyapa then addressed the crowd, "The victoriously-built son of Magadha, the unborn resentful king who first arouses faith, can provide the crowd with four necessities and make them lack for nothing, so it's appropriate for us to gather there."

source_sentence: 時諸大眾咸皆稱善。
translation: The crowd then all praised him as good.

source_sentence: 復有說云：「我等諸人，悉皆證得阿羅漢果，唯阿難陀獨居學地。
translation: It was also said, "All of us have realized the fruit of the arhat, except for Ānanda, who lives alone in the stage of training.

source_sentence: 又此具壽，世尊在日親為侍者，於佛法藏普能受持，果未圓備，此欲如何？」
translation: What does this full-life person want who was the Bhagavān's personal attendant during the days when he was able to universally retain the Buddha's Dharma treasury but whose fruit has yet to be fully realized want?"

source_sentence: 迦攝波曰：「若如是者作簡擇法，恐餘學人情生不忍，可為方便應差慶喜作行水人，餘人自去。」
translation: Kāśyapa said, "If someone like this were to do a brief selection of the teaching, I'm afraid the rest of the students would become intolerant, so perhaps it would be a good idea to send someone who's happy to be a practitioner of water, and the rest of you would leave."

source_sentence: 大眾言：「善！」
translation: The crowd said, "Good!"

source_sentence: 爾時具壽大迦攝波，對大眾前告阿難陀曰：「汝能為眾作行水人不？」
translation: It was then that the Kauśāmbī addressed Ānanda before the crowd, "Can you be a water walker for the people?"

source_sentence: 彼答言：「能。」
translation: They replied, "Yes."

source_sentence: 時迦攝波即作白二羯磨差之：「大德僧伽聽！
translation: Kāśyapa then made a proclamation to the two karmas, saying, "Listen, Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 此具壽阿難陀苾芻比親侍佛，所有法藏普能受持。
translation: This life-size Ananta monk personally serves the Buddha and is able to universally retain all of his dharma-store.

source_sentence: 若僧伽時至聽者，僧伽應許僧伽今差苾芻阿難陀供給眾僧作行水人。
translation: If the saṃgha agrees to listen, the saṃgha should permit the saṃgha to send Ananta the monk to serve the saṃgha as a water bearer.

source_sentence: 白如是。」
translation: I explain it this way."

source_sentence: 「大德僧伽聽！
translation: "Venerable monks, listen!

source_sentence: 此具壽阿難陀苾芻比親侍佛，所有法藏普能受持，僧伽今差阿難陀為眾行水。
translation: This Kauṇḍinya Ananta-bhikṣu served the Buddha personally and was able to universally retain the Dharma treasury, so the Saṃgha now sent Ananta to carry water for the crowd.

source_sentence: 若諸具壽聽阿難陀為眾行水者默然，若不許者說。」
translation: If any of these living beings hear Ananta's offering of water to the congregation, they'll be silent; if they don't permit it, they'll say so."

source_sentence: 「僧伽已差具壽阿難陀為眾行水竟，僧伽已聽許，由其默然故，我今如是持。」
translation: "After the saṃgha had sent Ananta with many lifetimes to carry water, the saṃgha heard and approved, and because he was silent, I now thus maintained it."

source_sentence: 時大迦攝波告阿難陀曰：「汝與大眾人間遊行，可詣彼摩揭陀國，我取直路而去。」
translation: Mahākāśyapa then addressed Ānanda, "You and the crowd may march among the people to Magadha, but I'll take the direct route and leave."

source_sentence: 時阿難陀與眾俱行詣王舍城。
translation: Ānanda then marched with the crowd to Rājagṛha.

source_sentence: 迦攝波在前而至，未生怨王於佛深信，若乘大象遙見佛時自墜于地，由佛威力身無傷損。
translation: Kāśyapa arrived ahead of him, and the king, who had yet to give rise to a grudge against the Buddha, was convinced that if he had ridden an elephant and seen him from a distance, he would have fallen to the ground himself, but he was unharmed by the Buddha's authority.

source_sentence: 王乘大象遙見迦攝波，憶念如來即便自墜。
translation: The king riding the elephant saw Kāśyapa from a distance, remembered the Tathāgata, and even fell to the ground himself.

source_sentence: 于時尊者以神力扶持不令有損，告言：「大王應知！
translation: At the time, the Venerable supported it with his supernormal powers so that it wouldn't be harmed, and he told it, "You should know, Great King!

source_sentence: 如來大師心常在定，聲聞弟子則不如是。
translation: The Tathāgata great teacher's mind is always in meditation, but śrāvaka disciples aren't.

source_sentence: 若不攝念觀察不知前事，有觀不觀，是故我今共王立制。
translation: If they don't collect mindfulness and observe and don't know what's ahead, and if they observe what's there but don't observe it, I'll work with the king to establish regulations.

source_sentence: 若見如來聲聞弟子，王乘象馬，不應造次自墜身形，宜當保愛。」
translation: If I see a disciple of the Tathāgata who's an śrāvaka or a king riding an elephant or horse, I shouldn't make a move and fall into my own body; I should take care of it."

source_sentence: 王曰：「如尊者教。
translation: The king said, "As the venerable taught.

source_sentence: 聖者應知，若佛在世我親供養，今既涅槃何處申敬？
translation: Noble ones should know that if the Buddha were alive, I would have made offerings to him, but now that he's gone, where can I show respect?

source_sentence: 仁則是我所敬世尊。
translation: "Sir, this is the Bhagavān whom I revere.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 如來教法並皆委寄。」
translation: The Tathāgata's teachings are all entrusted to him."

source_sentence: 作是語已，告大臣曰：「尊者大迦攝波四事供養無令闕乏。」
translation: After he said this, he told the minister, "Venerable Mahākāśyapa, there are four things for which offerings should never be lacking."

source_sentence: 尊者言：「大王當知！
translation: The venerable said, "You should know, Great King!

source_sentence: 佛於此國證大菩提法身成就，今於王處建立法幢結集三藏，苾芻大眾在路俱來。」
translation: The Buddha has realized the accomplishment of the great bodhisattva's Dharma body in this country, and now he's setting up a Dharma banner at the king's place to gather the Tripiṭaka, and the monks and nuns are coming along."

source_sentence: 王言：「善哉！
translation: The king said, "Good!

source_sentence: 我於聖眾但有所須悉皆供給。」
translation: Whatever the sages need, I will make offerings to them all."

source_sentence: 時諸聖眾不久欲至王舍大城，王聞欲至便勅諸臣，遠近貴賤一切人民，嚴飾城郭掃灑街衢，持妙華香寶幢幡蓋，及諸伎樂百千萬種。
translation: When the sages were about to arrive in the great city of Rājagṛha, the king, hearing of their arrival, ordered his ministers, as well as all the people from near and far, noble and base, to decorate the city and sweep the streets, carrying marvelous flowers and incense, jeweled banners and flags, and a hundred million kinds of music.

source_sentence: 王及后妃太子，內宮綵女國內人民，皆悉出城迎諸聖眾。
translation: The king, his consort, the crown prince, the inner palace maids, and the people of the country all left the city to welcome the sages.

source_sentence: 既入城已大眾坐定，王便致敬於上座前，合掌長跪白大德迦攝波言：「今日聖眾皆來至此，為諸眾生作大饒益，一切所須我當供給。
translation: After they had entered the city and the people were seated, the king paid homage to the sages and kneeled down with his palms together and said to the great virtuous Kāśyapa, "Today, the sages have all come here to do great good for sentient beings, and I will provide for whatever they need.

source_sentence: 我今不知於何處所，堪為敷設結集之會？」
translation: Now, I wonder where I can set up this assembly?"

source_sentence: 時尊者告言：「若於此城竹林園中作結集者，諸處僧來共相喧擾恐有妨廢。
translation: The Venerable then told him, "If we were to assemble here in the city's Bamboo Grove Park, we might be disrupted by the noise of monks coming from different places.

source_sentence: 若向鷲峰山亦不安靜，然畢鉢羅巖下堪為結集，然無臥具。」
translation: Even Vulture Peak wouldn't be quiet, but the lower part of Pippalāyāna would be a suitable place to gather, even though there would be no bedding."

source_sentence: 王聞語已深生歡喜，報迦攝波曰：「若於彼處結集定者，諸有所須臥具之類我當供給。」
translation: After hearing that, the king was profoundly pleased and reported to Kāśyapa, "If we were to assemble there for meditation, I would make offerings to those who need bedding."

source_sentence: 時迦攝波白大眾曰：「今此大王為諸聖眾，就畢鉢羅巖結集之處，諸有所須悉皆祇待令無所乏，仁等大眾宜當赴彼。」
translation: Kāśyapa then said to the crowd, "Now, the great king is setting up a gathering place at Pippalāyāna for all the sages, and he's waiting for all the necessities so that there's nothing to lack, so you, the people, should go there."

source_sentence: 王白迦攝波曰：「大覺世尊入涅槃時而不告我，唯願尊者久住世間，設將圓寂幸垂預告。」
translation: The king said to Kāśyapa, "The Bhagavān didn't tell me when he entered nirvāṇa, so I wish the Bhagavān had stayed in the world longer and would have been happy to give notice if he were to pass away completely."

source_sentence: 時迦攝波默然而許。
translation: Kāśyapa then acquiesced in silence.

source_sentence: 是時尊者復作是念：「於前夏中可修營房舍臥具，至後夏時當為結集。」
translation: The Venerable then again had this thought, "During the first summer, we could build a dwelling and bedding, and then we'll gather them together during the second summer."

source_sentence: 尊者即便觀阿難陀心，告具壽阿尼盧陀曰：「汝今於此世尊所讚大眾之中，誰是學人有染瞋癡，具足愛取所作未辦？」
translation: Even then, the Venerable observed Ananta's mind and addressed Aniruddha the Long-lived, saying, "Now, among the great multitude praised by the Bhagavān, which one of you is a student who's defiled by anger and delusion and is fully satisfied with grasping for what's yet to be done?"

source_sentence: 時阿尼盧陀入第四定觀察眾中，唯見具壽阿難陀獨居學地，具縛煩惱，所作未辦。
translation: Aniruddha then entered the fourth concentration and observed the multitude, except for the life-size Ananta, who was alone in the training ground, fettered by afflictions, and whose work hadn't been accomplished.

source_sentence: 觀已告迦攝波曰：「尊者應知此大聲聞，悉皆清淨無諸腐敗，唯有貞實具大福德所作已辦，堪受人天最上供養。
translation: After observing this, he told Kāśyapa, "Venerable, you should know that these great śrāvakas are all pure and have no corruption, except for the faithful, truly blessed ones who have accomplished their work and are worthy of the highest offerings from humans and gods.

source_sentence: 唯阿難陀獨居學地，具縛煩惱所作未辦。」
translation: Only Ānanda lives alone in the stage of training, and his work with binding afflictions has not yet been accomplished."

source_sentence: 時迦攝波即便觀察：「此阿難陀為是慰喻調伏？
translation: Kāśyapa then observed, "Is this Ānanda's reassuring metaphor for submission?

source_sentence: 為須呵責調伏？」
translation: Why should I rebuke and tame them?"

source_sentence: 見彼乃是以呵責言方可調伏，即於眾中喚阿難陀：「汝宜出去！
translation: Seeing that he could be subdued only by rebuking him, he called to Ānanda among the crowd, "You'd better get out!

source_sentence: 今此勝眾不應共爾同為結集。」
translation: This is an excellent assembly of people who shouldn't be gathered together like this."

source_sentence: 時阿難陀聞是語已，如箭射心舉身戰懼，白言：「大德迦攝波！
translation: After hearing those words, Ānanda raised his body in fear like an arrow shooting through his heart and said, "Mañjuśrī Kāśyapa!

source_sentence: 且止斯事幸願容恕，我不破戒、破見、破威儀、破正命，於僧伽中亦無違犯，如何今者忽為擯棄？」
translation: Still, I'm grateful for your forgiveness in this matter. I don't violate the precepts, view, manner, or right livelihood, nor do I transgress them in the saṃgha, so how could I suddenly reject them now?"

source_sentence: 尊者報曰：「汝親侍佛，云何破見戒威儀正命者何成希有？
translation: The Venerable returned the favor, "How is it that you, who are personally serving the Buddha, have broken the precepts and seen the dignity and right livelihood of those who have rarely existed?

source_sentence: 云於僧伽無違犯者，可起把籌，我出其過令汝自知。」
translation: Those of you who say you've done nothing wrong in the saṃgha may rise and put up your coffin, and I'll show you the error of your ways so that you'll know."

source_sentence: 時阿難陀即從坐起，當起之時三千大千世間三種震動：所謂小震、中震、大震；小搖、中搖、大搖；小動、中動、大動，於虛空中所有諸天，張目出聲作如是語：「嗚呼！
translation: When Ānanda then rose from his seat, the 3,000,000 worlds shook in three ways: a small tremor, a medium tremor, and a large tremor; a small shake, a medium shake, and a large shake; and a small movement, a medium movement, and a large movement, and all the gods in the sky opened their eyes and made a noise, saying, "Whoo!

source_sentence: 大迦攝波能得如是真言實語，此阿難陀近離世尊，即作如是出苦切言共相訶責。」
translation: When Mahākāśyapa truly spoke these words, this Ānanda, who had recently left the Bhagavān, then made this kind of rebuke by saying something painful and cutting."

source_sentence: 時迦攝波告阿難陀曰：「汝云：我於僧伽無違犯者，云何汝於僧伽得無愆犯？
translation: Kāśyapa then addressed Ānanda, "You said, 'If I didn't transgress the saṃgha, how did you become non-transgressors in the saṃgha?'

source_sentence: 汝知世尊不許女人，性懷憍諂而求出家。
translation: Do you know that the Bhagavān doesn't approve of women who seek to leave home because of their arrogant natures?

source_sentence: 如佛言曰：『阿難陀！
translation: As the Buddha said, 'Ānanda!

source_sentence: 汝勿為女人求請出家及近圓事。
translation: "Don't ask a woman to leave home or to approach the perfection of things.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 若令女人於我法中為出家者，法不久住，如好稻田被霜雹損竟無穀實。
translation: If I allow a woman to become a renunciant in my teaching, the teaching won't last long, like a good rice field that's damaged by frost and hail and then has no grain left in it.

source_sentence: 如是阿難陀！
translation: Thus, Ānanda!

source_sentence: 若令女人為出家者，法當損減不得久住。』
translation: If you allow a woman to become a renunciant, the Dharma will be diminished, and it won't last long.'

source_sentence: 汝請佛度，豈非過失？」
translation: Isn't it a mistake to ask the Buddha to save you?"

source_sentence: 阿難陀曰：「大德且止！
translation: Ānanda said, "Stop, Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 當見容恕，我無餘念請度女人，然大世主是佛姨母，摩耶夫人生佛七日便即命終。
translation: "I have no residual thoughts about the woman I'm asking to be saved, but the great lord of the world is the Buddha's aunt, and Lady Māya's life will end in seven days after she's born to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 世主親自乳養，既有深恩豈得不報？
translation: Since the lord himself nursed her, how could he not repay her for her profound kindness?

source_sentence: 又復我聞過去諸佛皆有四眾，望佛同彼。
translation: "Furthermore, I've heard that all the buddhas of the past had four groups of people who wanted the Buddha to be with them.

source_sentence: 一為報彼厚恩，二為流念氏族，為此請佛度諸女人，願容此過。」
translation: One was to repay their generous kindness, and the other was to remember their clans and ask the Buddha to save the women for this reason, hoping that this mistake would be tolerated."

source_sentence: 迦攝波告曰：「阿難陀！
translation: Kāśyapa told him, "Ānanda!

source_sentence: 此非報恩，便是滅壞正法身故，於佛田中下大霜雹，正法住世合滿千年，由汝能令少許存在。
translation: This is not repaying kindness, but it's destroying the body of the right Dharma and raining frost and hail on the Buddha's fields, which would cause a little bit of the right Dharma to exist if it were to last a thousand years.

source_sentence: 又云流念氏族者，此亦非理，出家之人永捨親愛。
translation: It's also wrong to say that people who are mindful of their clan should never abandon their loved ones.

source_sentence: 又云我聞過去諸佛皆有四眾，望佛同彼者，於曩昔時人皆少欲，於染瞋癡及諸煩惱悉皆微薄，彼合出家，今則不然。
translation: I've also heard that in the past, all the buddhas had four groups of people who wanted the Buddha to be like them.

source_sentence: 世尊不許，汝見苦求令佛聽許，是汝初過。
translation: The Bhagavān won't allow it, and you see it as your first mistake to ask so hard for the Buddha's approval.

source_sentence: 可下一籌。
translation: You may go down one notch.

source_sentence: 「又復有過，阿難陀！
translation: "There's another mistake, Ānanda!

source_sentence: 且如有人，於四神足若多修習，欲住世一劫或一劫餘，汝於佛所不為眾生請佛世尊住世一劫。」
translation: "Furthermore, suppose there's someone who cultivates the four miraculous abilities and wants to abide in the world for an eon or more than an eon, but you don't ask the Bhagavān to abide in the Buddha's hall for sentient beings for an eon."

source_sentence: 白言：「尊者！
translation: They said, "Venerable!

source_sentence: 我無餘念，當爾之時被魔障蔽。」
translation: I have no residual mindfulness of the fact that I was hindered by Māra at the time."

source_sentence: 答曰：「此是大過，寧容得有，近佛世尊塵習俱盡，而被魔羅波卑而為障蔽，此是第二過，可下一籌。
translation: He answered, "This is a great error that could hardly exist if the Bhagavān were to be obstructed by Māra Lāpapī while he's near the end of all his defilements and habits; this is the second error, and it's worth going down a peg.

source_sentence: 「汝復有過，世尊在日為說譬喻，汝對佛前別說其事，此是第三過，可下一籌。
translation: "Again, you have the fault of telling a parable while the Bhagavān was still in the sun and telling a different story to the Buddha, which is the third fault and could be taken down a peg.

source_sentence: 「汝復有過，世尊曾以黃金色洗裙，令汝浣濯，汝以脚踏捩衣，豈非是過？」
translation: "Again, is it not a fault of yours that the Bhagavān once washed a golden-washed skirt and told you to wash it, and you tied it with your foot?"

source_sentence: 阿難陀曰：「更無餘人，所以足踏非是慢意。」
translation: Ānanda said, "There's no one else, so stepping on it isn't a conceited thought."

source_sentence: 尊者曰：「若無人者何不擲上？
translation: The Venerable said, "If there's no one else, why doesn't he toss them up?

source_sentence: 虛空諸天自當助汝。
translation: The gods of space will certainly help you.

source_sentence: 是第四過，可更下一籌。
translation: This is the fourth mistake, and it's one step down from the others.

source_sentence: 「汝復有過，世尊欲趣雙樹涅槃為渴須水，汝以濁水奉佛，豈非是過？」
translation: "Again, isn't it a mistake for you to serve the Buddha with muddy water when the Bhagavān wants to enter nirvāṇa with two trees because he needs water for his thirst?"

source_sentence: 阿難陀曰：「我取水時，正屬脚拘陀河有五百乘車渡河，無清水可得，非我之咎。」
translation: Ānanda said, "It's not my fault that when I took the water, there were five hundred chariots crossing the river at Krakucchanda and no clear water was available."

source_sentence: 報曰：「此是汝過，當爾之時何不仰鉢向空，諸天自注八功德水置汝鉢中，此是第五過，可更下一籌。
translation: He replied, "This is your fault. Why don't you lift your bowl into the air and have the gods pour eight meritorious waters into your bowl? This is the fifth fault, and you can go one step down.

source_sentence: 「汝復有過，如世尊說：『我令苾芻半月半月說別解脫經所有小隨小戒，我於此中欲有放捨，令苾芻僧伽得安樂住故。』
translation: "You also have a fault, just as the Bhagavān said, 'I make monks teach half a month and half a month all the minor observances of the Sutra of Individual Liberation, and I want to have abandonment here so that the monks and nuns of the temple can live in comfort.'

source_sentence: 汝既不問：『未知此中何者名為小隨小戒？』
translation: Why don't you ask, 'Don't you know what these are called minor and circumstantial precepts?'

source_sentence: 今無問處，此欲如何？
translation: Now, there is no place to ask, what do you want from this?

source_sentence: 今且說四波羅市迦法、十三僧伽伐尸沙法、二不定法、三十泥薩祇波逸底迦法、九十波逸底迦法、四波羅底提舍尼法、眾多學法，除斯以外名小隨小戒。
translation: Now, let's say that the four prātimokṣas, 13 saṃghâvaśeṣa dharmas, two indeterminate dharmas, 30 rules of nirvāṇa, 90 rules of prātimokṣa, four rules of pratideśanīya, and numerous other rules for training are called minor and lesser precepts.

source_sentence: 有說云：『從四他勝乃至四對說法，餘名小隨小戒。』
translation: There's a teaching that says, 'From the four superior teachings of others up to the four opposing teachings, the others are called minor derivative precepts.'

source_sentence: 有說云：『從四他勝乃至九十墮罪，餘名小隨小。』
translation: It's also said, 'From the four superior others up to the ninety fallen sins, the rest are called minor and lesser.'

source_sentence: 有說：『從初乃至三十，餘名小隨小。』
translation: It's also said, 'From the beginning ... 30, the rest are called minor and minor.'

source_sentence: 有說：『從初乃至二不定，餘名小隨小。』
translation: Some say, 'From the beginning ... up to two uncertainties, the rest are called minor and follow minor.'

source_sentence: 有說：『唯四他勝，餘名小隨小。』
translation: Some say, 'Only four are superior to others, and the others are called minor and follow minor.'

translation: None of the monks then knew, 'What's minor and following minor?'

source_sentence: 於此中間外道聞已，遂得其便作如是語：『沙門喬答摩大為限齊，身存之日聲聞弟子教法全行，及其命終火燒已後教法隨滅，所有禁戒愛者即留、不愛便捨，多不奉行。』
translation: After hearing this, the laypeople in the interim then got their way and said, 'The ascetic Gautama was so limited that while he was alive, all the teachings of the śrāvaka disciples were practiced, and after his life ended and he was burned, the teachings then went out, and all the prohibitions and precepts that he loved were retained, and those that he didn't love were abandoned, and many of them weren't practiced.'

source_sentence: 汝何不為未來眾生請問世尊？
translation: Why don't you ask the Bhagavān about this for future sentient beings?

source_sentence: 由是合得追悔之罪。」
translation: Thus, it's possible to pursue the sin of repentance."

source_sentence: 阿難陀答言：「大德！
translation: Ānanda replied, "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 我無餘心而不請問，但為爾時離背如來生大憂苦。」
translation: I have no other intention than to ask questions and become very sad and distressed because I left the Tathāgata at that point."

source_sentence: 報言：「此亦是過，汝親侍佛，豈可不知諸行無常，而生憂惱斯成大過，此是第六過，可更下一籌。
translation: You replied, "This is also a mistake. How could you, who personally served the Buddha, not know that things are impermanent and become sad and distressed, which is a huge mistake? This is the sixth mistake, and it could be taken one step further.

source_sentence: 「汝復有過，於俗眾中對諸女前現佛陰藏相。」
translation: "You also have the mistake of showing the image of the Buddha's aggregates to women in a secular congregation."

source_sentence: 答言：「大德！
translation: They replied, "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 我無餘心，為諸女人欲染熾盛熱惱纏縛，若見世尊陰藏相者欲染便息。」
translation: I have no other mind that's tethered by women's desires that are feverish and tormented, but if I see the Bhagavān's aggregates, that desire and defilement will stop."

source_sentence: 尊者告曰：「汝無他心慧眼，寧知女人見佛陰藏欲染便息？
translation: The Bhagavān told him, "Without the wise eye of another's mind, how could you know that a woman's desire to see the Buddha's aggregates and store would be tainted and then calm down?

source_sentence: 此是第七過，可更下一籌。
translation: This is the seventh transgression, and it can be taken one step further.

source_sentence: 「汝復有過，輒自開佛黃金色身示諸女人，彼見佛身即便淚落霑污尊儀，此是汝過。」
translation: "You also have the mistake of readily revealing the golden body of the Buddha to women, and then when they see the Buddha's body, tears fall and stain their dignity.

source_sentence: 阿難陀曰：「我非無恥，然作是念：『有諸眾生，若見世尊妙色身者，皆發是言：「願我身相當得如佛。」』」
translation: Ānanda said, "I'm not shameless, but I do think, 'If there are sentient beings who see the Bhagavān's marvelously colored body, they all say, "May my physical appearance be like the Buddha's."'"

source_sentence: 迦攝波曰：「汝無他心慧眼，寧知眾生發如是願？
translation: Kāśyapa said, "Without the wisdom eye of another's mind, how could you know that sentient beings give rise to such a vow?

source_sentence: 此則是汝第八過失，可更下籌。
translation: This, then, is your eighth fault, which can be further investigated.

source_sentence: 又復汝未離欲，於是身在離欲眾中，是事不可。
translation: Furthermore, you haven't yet parted with desire, and this is an unacceptable thing for you to be in a congregation parted with desire.

source_sentence: 汝宜起去，殊勝聖眾不應與汝共為結集。」
translation: It's better for you to get up and leave, for the distinguished and noble people shouldn't be associated with you."

source_sentence: 時具壽阿難陀既被尊者大迦攝波詰其八事惡作罪已，四面觀察情懷悲歎，作如是語：「嗚呼苦哉！
translation: After Venerable Ānanda had been interrogated by Venerable Kāśyapa about the eight misdeeds, he looked around, felt compassion, and said, "Oh, suffering!

source_sentence: 如何我今一至於此，新離如來無依無怙，失大光明欲何所告？」
translation: How could I have arrived here, newly separated from the Tathāgata with no support and no foundation, and what would I tell him if I lost my great radiance?"

source_sentence: 尊者迦攝波詰彼罪時，空中諸天作嗟歎聲，互相告曰：「大仙當知！
translation: When Venerable Kāśyapa interrogated them about their crimes, the gods in the sky made a loud, sighing noise and told each other, "Great man, you should know!

source_sentence: 天眾增盛阿蘇羅減，世尊正法必當久住，此大聲聞道隣於佛，以其八事詰彼尊者，是大聲聞德亞於佛，是故我知佛法不滅。」
translation: The multitude of gods will increase and decrease, but the Bhagavān's right teaching will surely endure for a long time; this great śrāvaka's path is next to the Buddha's; this great śrāvaka's virtue is superior to the Buddha's when he is interrogated about the eight matters; therefore, I know that the Buddha's teaching will not cease."

source_sentence: 時阿難陀復白尊者言：「大德且止！
translation: Ānanda then again said to the Venerable, "Stop, Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 願施歡喜，我如法說罪不敢更為。
translation: May I rejoice in your generosity, for I will explain my crimes according to the teaching and dare not do it again.

source_sentence: 然佛世尊臨涅槃時作如是語：『阿難陀！
translation: Still, when the Bhagavān was about to enter nirvāṇa, he said this, 'Ānanda!

source_sentence: 我滅度後，汝勿憂惱悲啼號哭，我今以汝付大迦攝波。』
translation: Don't be distressed and lament after I die, for I'll now entrust you to Mahākāśyapa.'

source_sentence: 豈復尊者見我少過而不容忍，幸施歡喜奉大師教。」
translation: Could it be that the venerable saw a little fault in me and didn't tolerate it, and was fortunate enough to give joyfully to the great teacher's teaching?"

source_sentence: 迦攝波曰：「汝勿悲啼！
translation: Kāśyapa said, "Don't lament!

source_sentence: 善法由汝而得增長不為損減，我等必須結集如來所有聖教。
translation: Because you make it possible for the good Dharma to grow and not decrease, we must assemble all of the Tathāgata's noble teachings.

source_sentence: 汝今可去離茲聖眾，不應共汝同為結集。」
translation: Now, you can go and leave this noble assembly; we shouldn't assemble it together with you."

source_sentence: 時具壽阿尼盧陀，白尊者迦攝波曰：「無阿難陀我等云何而為結集？」
translation: Kauṣṭhila Aniruddha then said to Venerable Kāśyapa, "Without Ānanda, how could we have assembled this?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「此阿難陀雖備眾德，然猶未離欲染瞋癡，有學有事，不可與彼同為結集。」
translation: He replied, "Although this Ānanda possesses many virtues, he's still not free of desire, defilement, and delusion, and there are things he's training for, so he shouldn't be grouped with him."

source_sentence: 時迦攝波復告阿難陀曰：「即宜速出！
translation: Kāśyapa then again told Ānanda, "It's time to leave quickly!

source_sentence: 所應作者當自策勤，得阿羅漢果，眾可與汝同為結集。」
translation: The worthy author will endeavor on his own to attain the fruit of the arhat, and all will be able to assemble with you."

source_sentence: 時阿難陀離別大師情懷悲戀，復被詰擯倍加憂惱，從此而出詣增勝聚落作夏安居，以村中童子而為侍者。
translation: Being sad and longing to part with the teacher, Ananta was further distressed by his interrogation, so he left and went to the village of Zunsheng to spend the summer retreat, using the village boy as his attendant.

source_sentence: 爾時具壽阿難陀，於此時中極加勤勇，常為四眾而說妙法。
translation: At the time, Ananta, with great diligence and courage, was always teaching the wonderful Dharma to the four groups of people.

source_sentence: 是時童子作如是念：「我鄔波馱耶，為是學地得離欲耶？
translation: The boy then had this thought, "Upādhyāya, is this the stage of training where I attain freedom from desire?

source_sentence: 為是無學得離欲耶？
translation: Is it because of this post-learner that one can become free of desire?

source_sentence: 我今宜可入相應定觀察其心。」
translation: Now, it would be appropriate for me to enter the associated concentration and examine his mind."

source_sentence: 即便入定，見尊者心是有學離欲，見已出定，詣尊者所立在一面，說伽他曰：「可依樹下幽閑處，　　一心當念涅槃宮；　師今謹慎務勤修，　　不久必歸圓寂路。」
translation: Even after he had entered that concentration, he saw that the Venerable's mind was cultivated and free of desire, and after he had emerged from that concentration, he went to the Venerable and stood to one side, saying to him, "You may rely on that quiet place under the trees, where your mind will be focused on the palace of nirvāṇa; now, teacher, be careful and diligent in your cultivation, and soon you will surely return to the path of perfect tranquility."

source_sentence: 是時尊者見彼童子說要義已，即於晝日或坐或行，於諸障法鍊磨其心，於初夜時或行或坐，亦復堅心淨除障法。
translation: After seeing that boy explain the essentials, the Venerable then spent the daytime either sitting or walking, training his mind in the hindrances, and in the early evening either walking or sitting, he also resolutely purified his mind and removed the hindrances.

source_sentence: 即於中夜洗足入房，右脇而臥兩足相重，作光明想正念起想。
translation: That is, in the middle of the night, he washes his feet and enters his room, lies down on his right side with his feet pressed together, and creates the perception of his head shining brightly and the perception of right mindfulness rising.

source_sentence: 如是作意頭未至枕，斷盡諸漏心得解脫，證阿羅漢果受解脫樂。
translation: Thus intending to reach his head before he touches his pillow, he ends the contaminants and attains liberation, realizing the fruit of the arhat and the happiness of liberation.

source_sentence: 即詣王舍城至大眾所，眾知得果咸皆讚歎是大丈夫。
translation: He then went to the city of Rājagṛha and went to the great assembly, where everyone who knew he had attained the fruit praised him as a great man.

source_sentence: 是時大迦攝波與五百阿羅漢，至畢鉢羅巖所，既集會已告大眾曰：「汝等應知！
translation: Mahākāśyapa and 500 arhats then went to Pippalāyāna and, having assembled there, told the crowd, "You should know!

source_sentence: 於當來世有諸苾芻，鈍根散亂，若無攝頌，於經律論不能讀誦及以受持。
translation: In a future life, there will be monks whose dull faculties are scattered, and without verses, they won't be able to recite or memorize the sūtras, vinaya, and treatises.

source_sentence: 是故我等宜於食前先集攝略伽他事相應者，食後可集經律及論。」
translation: Therefore, it's appropriate for us to gather those who are associated with the scriptures, precepts, and treatises before we eat, and then we can gather the scriptures, precepts, and treatises after we eat."

source_sentence: 時諸苾芻聞是語已，白尊者言：「今可先集伽他。」
translation: After hearing these words, the monks said to the venerable, "Now, we can first gather the skandhas."

source_sentence: 既至食後白言：「先集何者？」
translation: Once they had finished eating, they said, "Which one should we gather first?"

source_sentence: 尊者告曰：「宜先集經。」
translation: The Venerable told them, "It's a good idea to gather the sūtras first."

source_sentence: 時五百阿羅漢，各共同請大迦攝波昇師子座，尊者登座告阿難陀曰：「具壽！
translation: Five hundred arhats then each invited Mahākāśyapa to ascend to the lion's seat, and the Venerable ascended to his seat and told Ānanda, "Gosu!

source_sentence: 頗能簡擇結集如來所說經不？」
translation: Will he be able to summarize the scriptures taught by the Tathāgata?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「能。」

source_sentence: 尊者即便作白：「大德僧伽聽！

source_sentence: 若僧伽時至聽者，僧伽應許僧伽今差具壽阿難陀，為欲簡擇結集如來所說經法。
translation: If the saṃgha does not agree to listen, the saṃgha should permit the saṃgha to send Ananta Arhat to assemble the sūtras taught by the Tathāgata for the purpose of briefly selecting and assembling the teachings.

source_sentence: 「大德僧伽聽！

source_sentence: 此具壽阿難陀能為簡擇結集如來所說經法。
translation: "This is Kauśānanda, who can assemble the sūtras taught by the Tathāgata for the purpose of briefly discriminating and collecting the teachings.

source_sentence: 僧伽今差具壽阿難陀為欲簡擇結集如來所說經法。
translation: Now, the saṃgha has sent Ananta with a specific life span who wants to assemble the sūtras taught by the Tathāgata for the purpose of briefly selecting and assembling the Dharma.

source_sentence: 若諸具壽聽阿難陀為欲簡擇結集如來所說經法者默然，若不許者說。」
translation: If those with long lives hear Ananta's desire to assemble the sūtras taught by the Tathāgata for the purpose of briefly selecting and assembling the Dharma, they'll be silent, or if they don't permit it, they'll say so."

source_sentence: 「僧伽已與具壽阿難陀為欲簡擇結集如來所說經法竟，僧伽已聽許，由其默然故，我今如是持。」
translation: "After the saṃgha and Kauśānī Ananta had finished assembling the sūtras taught by the Tathāgata for their brief selection, the saṃgha heard and approved, and because he was silent, I'll now maintain it this way."

source_sentence: 時具壽阿難陀既欲說法，五百阿羅漢各各皆以僧伽胝衣敷其座上。
translation: When Kauṣṭhila Ānanda wanted to preach, each of the five hundred arhats spread out his or her monk's robe on the seat.

source_sentence: 時阿難陀四邊顧望，於諸有情發悲愍念，於正法中極生尊重，於梵行者起敬仰心，右繞高座低頭申敬，於上座前依法敬禮作無常想，以手按座正身端坐，次審觀察見諸聖眾，猶如甚深湛然大海，便作是念：「我於佛所親聞是經，或有傳說、或龍宮說、或天上說，悉皆受持而不忘失，我今應說。」
translation: Looking around, Ānanda aroused compassion for sentient beings, showed great respect for religious practitioners, arouse respect for them, circled the high seat to his right, bowed his head in reverence, paid homage in accordance with the rules in front of the high seat, made perceptions of impermanence, pressed his hand against the seat, correctly sat down with his body, and then examined and observed the noble congregations as if they were a vast, deep, azure ocean.

source_sentence: 時諸天眾互相謂曰：「仁等當知！

source_sentence: 時有天子說伽陀曰：「若能建妙法，　　饒益三千界；　聖者法無畏，　　猶如師子吼。
translation: Then a celestial spoke to Gadha, saying, "If he could build a marvelous Dharma that would benefit the 3,000 worlds, the noble one would be fearless in his teaching, like a lion's roar.

source_sentence: 仁等應至誠，　　聽說微妙法；　所欲安樂者，　　知此真實義。」
translation: You should listen wholeheartedly, explain the subtle Dharma, and those who want to be comfortable should know its true meaning."

source_sentence: 爾時尊者迦攝波，以頌告阿難陀曰：「具壽今當宣佛語，　　一切法中最為上；　凡是大師所說法，　　咸能利益於眾生。」
translation: Venerable Kāśyapa then addressed Ānanda with a verse, "Kauśāmbī will now proclaim the Buddha's words, which are the most excellent of all teachings, and whatever the great teacher teaches will benefit sentient beings."

source_sentence: 時阿難陀聞說大師名，心生戀慕遂便迴首望涅槃處虔誠合掌，以普遍音作如是語：「如是我聞，一時薄伽梵在婆羅痆斯仙人墮處施鹿林中。
translation: When Ānanda heard the name of the great teacher spoken, his heart grew fond of him, so he turned his head back to the place of nirvāṇa, put his palms together in reverence, and spoke with a universal voice, saying, "Thus I've heard that one time the Bhagavān was in the Deer Preserve in Vārāṇasī.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊告五苾芻曰：『此苦聖諦，於所聞法如理作意，能生眼智明覺。』
translation: The Bhagavān then addressed five monks, 'This noble truth of suffering, when correctly contemplated in terms of the teaching heard, can give rise to vision, knowledge, insight, and awakening.'

source_sentence: 此中廣說如上三轉法輪經。」
translation: This is explained in detail in the sutra on the three turns of the wheel of the Dharma, as above."

source_sentence: 時具壽阿若憍陳如告大迦攝波曰：「此微妙法親從佛聞，世尊慈悲為我宣說，由是經力能令我等，枯竭無邊血淚大海，超越骨山，關閉惡趣無間之門，善開天宮解脫之路，說此微妙甚深經時。
translation: Kauśāmbī Kauṇḍinya then addressed Mahākāśyapa, "I heard this subtle teaching from the Buddha himself, and the Bhagavān compassionately explained it for me; because of the power of this sūtra, we were able to dry up the endless ocean of blood and tears, transcend the mountain of bones, close the unremitting gates of the evil destinies, and skillfully open the path to liberation in the heavenly palace when he taught this subtle and profound sūtra.

source_sentence: 我既聞已，於一切法，離諸塵垢得法眼淨，八萬諸天皆蒙利益。」
translation: After I heard it, I parted with all the defilements of the Dharma and attained purification of the Dharma eye, and 80,000 gods were all benefited."
